definition: to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.english: A. We tend to run meetings a bit like a food fight here at CCMP.
sentences.chinese: 我們在CCMP開會有點像食物爭奪戰。

sentences.english: The victory opened the period of great prosperity for Liubei.
sentences.chinese: 漢中爭奪戰的勝利，開啓了劉備事業的鼎盛時期。

sentences.english: And so the age-old fight over land and food has begun anew.
sentences.chinese: 就這樣，一場古老的土地與食物爭奪戰又拉開了序幕。

sentences.english: The employers who do are winning in the war for young talent .
sentences.chinese: 能這樣做的僱主，在年輕俊彥爭奪戰中才能勝出。

sentences.english: Now the fight for gene is in progress within the world-wide scope.
sentences.chinese: 目前，在世界範圍內正進行着一場“基因爭奪戰”。

sentences.english: Teams from five universities battled for the prize in the basketball match.
sentences.chinese: 來自五所大學的籃球隊爲奪標而展開了爭奪戰。

sentences.english: Jingdong and Alibaba's Taobao Mall are at the center of the battle for that market.
sentences.chinese: 京東和阿里巴巴旗下的淘寶商城是這場爭奪戰的主角。

sentences.english: What she does not know is that she is at the heart of a battle being fought here in Jakarta - over alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 然而她卻不知道，她正處於雅加達酒水爭奪戰之中。

sentences.english: So it will be an internal fight over allocations.
sentences.chinese: 所以這將會使一場內部股份爭奪戰。

sentences.english: The result of this is that the Scudetto race has re-opened.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的結果就是聯賽冠軍的爭奪戰又重新開始。

definition: to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with
Four Asian Tigers/East Asian Tigers/Four Little Dragons (East Asian economic powers: Taiwan, South Korea, Singapore and Hong Kong)
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
